body_html: The convention in PyTorch and ONNX is that 1024 is the input channels (aka channels), 512 is the output channels (aka feature maps), and you put input channels first in the weights as per https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/docs/Operators.md#ConvTranspose ; thus tthis is the shape I would expect. Am I missing something?
body_text: The convention in PyTorch and ONNX is that 1024 is the input channels (aka channels), 512 is the output channels (aka feature maps), and you put input channels first in the weights as per https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/docs/Operators.md#ConvTranspose ; thus tthis is the shape I would expect. Am I missing something?
body: The convention in PyTorch and ONNX is that 1024 is the input channels (aka channels), 512 is the output channels (aka feature maps), and you put input channels first in the weights as per https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/docs/Operators.md#ConvTranspose ; thus tthis is the shape I would expect. Am I missing something?
